title: Monasticism
desc:
Post 1146
- When played, all players gain the option to play their cards with abilities in "Zen form" on their turn. Players who are skipped may still take their turn, but may only play Zen cards.
- When a card is played in Zen form, it is played as a basic card without abilities.
- All players are under these effects:
- Each time you play a card in Zen form, you gain 1 Karma.
- When you skip another player or force another player to draw cards, you lose 1 Karma for each player effected.
- At the end of the game if Monasticism is still in play, the player with the most Karma also wins.
- Monasticism is removed once no player has played a card in Zen form for an entire turn.
